page.title: 06THE SEA FRONT IN HERNE BAY
page.content: For the holiday makers there are trampolines, a slide and a roundabout on the beach and deckchairs can be hired.There is a children's holiday show in the bandstand and also a small track where people can try out the new Sinclair C5 electric tricycle. Several local people have beach huts as their base for a day at the sea. Particularly popular with the teenagers are the amusement arcades with rows of electronic bleeping machines. There are many cafes and reasonably priced restaurants along the seafront but unfortunately 1985 is proving to be one of the wettest English summers on record, thousands of people are making late bookings for Spain, and many people who depend on Herne Bay's meagre tourist trade will be badly hit.
